This class provides useful methods for the backend WPS process manager

Method Detail

addSubstitutionVariables

public void addSubstitutionVariables(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> wpsVariables)
The method adds new substitution variables related to WPS directories (i.e ${WPS_JOB_INPUTS_DIR}, ${WPS_JOB_OUTPUTS_DIR}, etc.). These variables should be defined one time (when WPS starts) then used in any job instance. Typically, the PI uses these variables in the JSDL. WPS Context - The method is called once, when WPS is initialized, in order to provide useful substitution variables available for the PI.

Parameters:
wpsVariables - substitution variables key-values pairs

Example:
"WPS_JOB_INPUTS_DIR" -> "/home/wps/execute/jobs/${GAI_JOB_UID}/inputs"
"WPS_JOB_OUTPUTS_DIR" -> "/home/wps/execute/jobs/${GAI_JOB_UID}/outputs"

substituteSimpleInputs

public void substituteSimpleInputs(JobDescription jd,
                                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> inputValues)
                            throws org.ogf.saga.error.NoSuccessException
The method replaces every occurrence of the given "substitution" variables (in ANY job description attribute) with the given values in the JobDescription jd 1. The given value of a variable could itself include another substitution variable (such as ${JOB_ID}). 2. When the given variable name is "xxx", the method looks for (and replaces) occurrences of "${xxx}" in the JobDescription.

Parameters:
jd - the job description (created from the JSDL template)
inputValues - a mapping of the substitution variables with their value (WPS previously builds this map from the Execute request inputs)

Examples:
"WPS_INPUT_distance" --> "10" "WPS_INPUT_numberOfCPUs" --> "5" "WPS_INPUT_outputFormat" --> "DAT"
Throws:
org.ogf.saga.error.NoSuccessException

writeComplexInputs

public void writeComplexInputs(JobImpl jobs,
                               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,org.w3c.dom.Document> inputDocuments)
                        throws javax.xml.xpath.XPathExpressionException,
                               org.ogf.saga.error.BadParameterException,
                               org.ogf.saga.error.IncorrectStateException,
                               org.ogf.saga.error.NoSuccessException
For each input (a list of URL's), it splits the m (XPATH "/ssegrid:URLList/@count") children elements (XPATH "/ssegrid:URLList/ssegrid:url") into n lists of URL's separated by a line feed (n= total number of tasks = jobs.length), then writes the file as [input identifier].[taskId] in ${ WPS_JOB_INPUTS_DIR }. Note: This method can be used on both POSIX Applications and SPMD Applications. For POSIX Applications, n=1 is assumed (i.e. no splitting) and the .[taskId] extension is not used.

Parameters:
jobs - the related job
inputDocuments - a mapping of input identifier with the XML Document
Throws:
javax.xml.xpath.XPathExpressionException
org.ogf.saga.error.IncorrectStateException
org.ogf.saga.error.BadParameterException
org.ogf.saga.error.NoSuccessException

readSimpleOutputs

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> readSimpleOutputs(JobImpl job)
                                                                   throws org.ogf.saga.error.IncorrectStateException,
                                                                          org.ogf.saga.error.BadParameterException,
                                                                          java.io.IOException
Read in ${WPS_JOB_OUTPUTS_DIR } the content of every given output files (used in single-task jobs only) and construct a map of filename with file content. Note: This method can be used only for POSIX Applications.

Parameters:
job - the (single-task) job instance
Returns:
the map of output identifiers with their string value
Throws:
org.ogf.saga.error.IncorrectStateException
org.ogf.saga.error.BadParameterException
java.io.IOException

readComplexOutputs

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,org.w3c.dom.Document> readComplexOutputs(JobImpl jobs,
                                                                               java.lang.String[] outputNames)
                                                                        throws org.ogf.saga.error.IncorrectStateException,
                                                                               org.ogf.saga.error.BadParameterException,
                                                                               java.io.IOException,
                                                                               javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException
For each given output name, read in ${WPS_JOB_OUTPUTS_DIR} the tasks output files as [output identifier].[taskId] containing textual URLâ€™s lists; then merges these files into a single XML document. Note: This method can be used on both POSIX Applications and SPMD Applications. For POSIX Applications, n=1 is assumed (i.e. no merging) and the .[taskId] extension is not used.

Parameters:
jobs - the (multi-task) job instance
outputNames - the list of ComplexData output names (note that WPS will use the output identifier as file name)
Returns:
the map containing one xml document for every Output file
Throws:
org.ogf.saga.error.IncorrectStateException - thrown if there is an error retrieving substitution variable ${WPS_JOB_OUTPUTS_DIR}
org.ogf.saga.error.BadParameterException - thrown if one of the parameters is null or empty
java.io.IOException - thrown if there is an error in Input/Output operations on the FileSystem
javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException - thrown if there is an error building the document

readExitMessages

public java.lang.String[][] readExitMessages(JobImpl jobs)
                                      throws org.ogf.saga.error.BadParameterException,
                                             org.ogf.saga.error.IncorrectStateException,
                                             java.io.FileNotFoundException
Reads in ${WPS_JOB_OUTPUTS_DIR} the tasks exit message files as exitMessage.[taskId] containing an exit code and an optional exit text; then, for each exit message file found in that directory, merges these files into a table of exit codes and exit texts. Note: This method can be used on both POSIX Applications and SPMD Applications. For POSIX Applications, n=1 is assumed (i.e. no merging) and the .[taskId] file extension is not used.

Parameters:
jobs - the (multi-task) job instance
Returns:
A table with the merged exit messages
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - thrown if Complex Output file not found
org.ogf.saga.error.IncorrectStateException - thrown if there is a error retrieving substitution variable ${WPS_JOB_OUTPUTS_DIR}
org.ogf.saga.error.BadParameterException - thrown if the job array is null or empty
